docs.lead_paragraph: FOR centuries it has been known that the invisible rays of the sun are of great importance in the growth and health of plants. Sun baths were prescribed for the sick during the early Greek and Roman period. Yet in modern times attention was focused rather on the heat and visible light rays than on those short, invisible, ultraviolet radiation that cause sunburn.

headline.main: CURES BY SUN'S RAYS TO BE STUDIED; World Conference Is Called to Compare Results Obtained Leaders in the Discussions. A Landmark in Medicine.
